entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:21AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED RISK OF FIRE IGNITION AND SPREAD TODAY... The combination of a very dry airmass and increasingly breezy northeasterly winds this afternoon will result in an elevated fire weather threat. Fires that ignite in these weather conditions can spread rapidly, making them hard to control. For this reason, consider postponing any outdoor burning.

Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .Warmer temperatures will allow for high-elevation snowmelt to continue. Automated snowpack estimates reveal about 6.5 inches of water remaining in the snowpack in the mountains around 9,500 feet

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 11:08AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton Wyoming continues the Flood Warning for the following river in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Warmer temperatures will allow for high-elevation snowmelt this week. However, water levels on the Bear River are still expected to slowly recede as much of the snow below the 9,000-foot elevation has
